policies.title: Secure Development Lifecycle
policies.policy_text: The organization shall integrate security into all stages of the software development lifecycle, including requirements analysis, design, coding, testing, deployment, and maintenance. Developers must follow secure coding practices to prevent common vulnerabilities such as SQL injection and cross-site scripting. All code changes must undergo peer review and automated security analysis. Secure coding guidelines must be documented and enforced, including input validation, parameterized queries for database interactions, and output encoding for web content. Third-party components must be evaluated for security risks before integration. The development process must include regular security training for developers.

policies.title: Security Testing in Development and Acceptance
policies.policy_text: The organization shall perform security testing at multiple stages of development and before acceptance into production. Static application security testing (SAST) must be conducted on source code, dynamic application security testing (DAST) on running applications, and interactive testing where appropriate. Tests must cover common web vulnerabilities including SQL injection and XSS. Results must be reviewed, risks assessed, and remediation plans created. No code may be deployed to production without passing security tests. Retesting must occur after remediation to confirm fixes.

policies.title: Management of Technical Vulnerabilities
policies.policy_text: The organization shall maintain a vulnerability management process to identify, assess, and remediate technical vulnerabilities in a timely manner. Vulnerabilities in operating systems, applications, and third-party components must be scanned regularly using automated tools. Known vulnerabilities in dependencies like npm packages must be checked via SCA tools such as npm audit. Vulnerabilities must be prioritized based on severity, exploitability, and business impact. Remediation must follow defined timelines, with critical issues addressed within 7 days. Patches and updates must be tested in a staging environment before production deployment. A central vulnerability tracking system must monitor status and report on compliance.

Implement patch management procedures

Conduct quarterly vulnerability assessments
verification_methods: Review SCA scan results and remediation logs

policies.title: Application Security Requirements
policies.policy_text: The organization shall define security requirements for all applications, ensuring protection against injection attacks, XSS, and insecure dependencies. Requirements must include secure authentication, input validation, output encoding, and dependency management. Applications must be designed with security in mind, incorporating threat modeling. Security must be verified through testing and monitoring. No application may process sensitive data without meeting these requirements. Updates to dependencies must be evaluated for security impacts before implementation.

policies.title: Information Security in Supplier Relationships
policies.policy_text: The organization shall incorporate information security requirements into relationships with suppliers and third-party providers, including software dependency vendors. Security assessments must be performed on critical suppliers, such as those providing npm packages like express and jsonwebtoken. Contracts must include clauses for vulnerability disclosure, timely patching, and compliance with security standards. Supplier risks must be monitored continuously, with alternatives evaluated for high-risk vendors. Incident reporting and remediation coordination must be defined in agreements.
